1.text: A Psalm of David.  Bless the LORD, O my soul: and all that is within me, bless his holy name.

2.text: Bless the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:

3.text: Who forgiveth all thine iniquities; who healeth all thy diseases;

4.text: Who redeemeth thy life from destruction; who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;

5.text: Who satisfieth thy mouth with good things; so that thy youth is renewed like the eagle's.

6.text: The LORD executeth righteousness and judgment for all that are oppressed.

7.text: He made known his ways unto Moses, his acts unto the children of Israel.

8.text: The LORD is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.

9.text: He will not always chide: neither will he keep his anger for ever.

10.text: He hath not dealt with us after our sins; nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.

11.text: For as the heaven is high above the earth, so great is his mercy toward them that fear him.

12.text: As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.

13.text: Like as a father pitieth his children, so the LORD pitieth them that fear him.

14.text: For he knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we are dust.

15.text: As for man, his days are as grass: as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.

16.text: For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; and the place thereof shall know it no more.

17.text: But the mercy of the LORD is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him, and his righteousness unto children's children;

18.text: To such as keep his covenant, and to those that remember his commandments to do them.

19.text: The LORD hath prepared his throne in the heavens; and his kingdom ruleth over all.

20.text: Bless the LORD, ye his angels, that excel in strength, that do his commandments, hearkening unto the voice of his word.

21.text: Bless ye the LORD, all ye his hosts; ye ministers of his, that do his pleasure.

22.text: Bless the LORD, all his works in all places of his dominion: bless the LORD, O my soul.
